Name: Establishing ferry service between St. George and Bay Ridge.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing ferry service between St. George and Bay Ridge

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Summary: This bill would require the establishment of a regular ferry service connecting St. George in the borough of Staten Island to Bay Ridge in the borough of Brooklyn.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 3 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-309 to read as follows:
      � 19-309 Ferry service required. a. The mayor shall ensure that regular ferry service is provided connecting St. George in the borough of Staten Island to Bay Ridge in the borough of Brooklyn and shall designate either a city agency or a contracted entity, as such term is defined in 22-821, to manage or operate such service.
      b. Such service shall be open to the public and be integrated with the city's existing ferry system to the maximum extent practicable.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 1 year after it becomes law.



LMH
LS #18497
5/6/2025
